title: Who is Sleepy Jean and why did they need to cheer up? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi. Sleepy Jean is the narrator's wife. She needs to cheer up because she is young, against divorce and stuck (for life) with her young husband. Instead of turning and running (or messing around with the plumber) she stays faithful…and miserable. The narrator realizes the dream of being “high school sweethearts” isn't all it's cracked up to be and that his wife is unhappy. Instead of divorcing he tells her to “cheer up"…because: “life can't always be this bad…can it?…it can?…then we’ll keep turning lemons into lemonade until one or both of us drown.” Cheers. (for the life of me I can't figure out why these lyrics confuse people…”American Pie", it ain't…)

John Stewart, who wrote Daydream Believer, explained that it was the second of what he called a “suburbia trilogy.” What happened to the first and third songs, only he knows. I'm only speculating, but it would seem things weren't as happy by the time he wrote Daydream Believer.
